alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 12:14PM CST until March 10 at 1:20AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Savannah For the Tennessee River...including Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Savannah. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 374.0 feet, The intersection of Towboat Lane, Bargeview Lane, and Coffee Landing Road is flooded. Low spots near the west end of Connie Beth Lane are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 374.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 373.7 feet and then begin rising early tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise again to 373.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall to 373.4 feet and then begin rising early Sunday afternoon. It will then rise again to 373.5 feet early Monday morning. It will fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
